caption.p: Structural evidence of lipids interacting with membrane proteins. From left to right, a POPG molecule bound to the K + channel KcsA ( Valiyaveetil et al., 2002), lipids bound to the interface of a single monomer of the water channel Aqp0 ( Hite et al., 2010), and a ring of lipids resolved in the x-ray crystal structure of the Ca 2+-ATPase by phase contrast imaging ( Norimatsu et al., 2017).
